thread.title: Top 8 Must-Visit Religious Sites In Jammu and Kashmir
thread.title_full: Top 8 Must-Visit Religious Sites In Jammu and Kashmir

author: Kumar Utkarsh
title: Top 8 Must-Visit Religious Sites In Jammu and Kashmir
text: Jammu and Kashmir is known for its rich religious heritage and breathtaking natural beauty. Here are some religious places you might want to visit. 01 Jun, 2024 Kumar Utkarsh Martand Sun Temple: Although now in ruins, this ancient Hindu temple dedicated to the Sun God is an architectural marvel. Raghunath Temple: Situated in Jammu city, this temple complex dedicated to Lord Rama. Jamia Masjid, Srinagar: Built-in the 14th century, this grand mosque in Srinagar is a fine example of Indo-Saracenic architecture. Charar-e-Sharif: Charar-e-Sharif: This revered Sufi shrine in Budgam district is the resting place of Sheikh Noor-ud-din Noorani. Amarnath Cave Temple: Situated at an altitude of 3,888 meters, this cave temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Shankaracharya Temple: Positioned atop a hill in Srinagar, this ancient temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Hazratbal Shrine: This revered Muslim shrine houses a relic believed to be a hair strand of the Prophet Muhammad. Vaishno Devi Temple: This temple dedicated to Goddess Vaishno Devi is one of the most visited religious sites in India. Thanks For Reading!
